page.title: 05THE ROSEBERYS (cont 2)
page.content: The{6th Earl}shared his father's passion for horses and owned large stud farms at Mentmore. However in his lifetime, many of his houses had to be sold, starting with the Villa Rosebery to the British government and culminating with the sale of Mentmore in 1977. The{present Earl}and his wife use Dalmeny as a family home. The Earl has five children _ four daughters and a son. The eldest daughter, Lucy, is married and lives in England. Emma is also married and lives in Hong Kong. Jane studies Law in London and Caroline studies agriculture in New Zealand. The heir to the earldom,{Harry, Lord {Dalmeny,}is eighteen and in his final year at Eton. Like his sister, he too plans to enter the legal profession.
